markdown:
logo: Mclean Equity Research Summary : This image displays the logo for "Mclean Equity Research" with the company name and the word "Research" enclosed within a white oval on a blue background. Logo Elements : • Text: "Mclean Equity" (large font), "Research" (smaller font, centered below). • Shape: White oval outline encircling the text. • Background: Solid blue rectangle. • Font: Sans-serif, white text. • Layout: "Mclean Equity" is on the top line, "Research" is centered below within the oval. Dimensions & Placement : • The oval is horizontally elongated, centered within the blue rectangle. • The text is centered both vertically and horizontally within the oval. Analysis : • The logo uses a simple, professional design with a blue and white color scheme, likely to convey trust and reliability in financial research. Summary : This bar chart compares Return on Equity (ROE) and Economic Profit (EP) as percentages over quarterly periods from Q1 2022 to Q1 2025, illustrating trends in shareholder value. bar chart: # Title & Axes : • Title: "Shareholder Value" • X-axis: Quarterly periods from Q1 2022 to Q1 2025 (labels: Q1 2022, Q2 2022, Q3 2022, Q4 2022, Q1 2023, Q2 2023, Q3 2023, Q4 2023, Q1 2024, Q2 2024, Q3 2024, Q4 2024, Q1 2025) • Y-axis (right): "Percent %" with tick marks at -30, -25, -20, -15, -10, -5, 0, 5, 10 # Data Points : • ROE (Return on Equity): Blue bars, positive values, generally between 0% and 5% for all quarters. • EP (Economic Profit): Red bars, negative values, generally between -20% and -25% for all quarters. # Design Encodings : • ROE: Solid blue bars, labeled "ROE" at the top of each bar. • EP: Solid red bars, labeled "EP" at the bottom of each bar. • Legend: Blue square for ROE, light teal square for EP. • Background: Alternating light blue and white vertical bands for each quarter. # Distribution & Trends : • ROE remains positive but low (0% to 5%) across all quarters. • EP remains negative and relatively stable (around -20% to -25%) across all quarters. • No quarters show positive EP. # Analysis : • The company consistently generates positive but modest ROE, while EP is persistently negative, indicating that although equity returns are positive, they do not exceed the cost of capital. There is no significant upward or downward trend in either metric over the observed period. - ● This chart shows if a company is earning both an accounting profit (ROE) and an Owner Earnings (OE). - ● OE is our proprietary metric used to determine if a company is currently adding to shareholder value. - ● At McLean Equity Research, we believe the distinction between making an investment versus speculation is whether or not a company is creating shareholder value. - ● The chart shows a negative trend to creating shareholder value. Summary : This bar chart presents the cash flow components—ER, OC, and FC—over quarterly periods from Q1 2022 to Q1 2025, with values in US dollars (millions). bar chart: Title & Axes : • Title: "Cash Flow". • X-axis: Quarterly periods from Q1 2022 to Q1 2025 (labels: Q1 2022, Q2 2022, Q3 2022, Q4 2022, Q1 2023, Q2 2023, Q3 2023, Q4 2023, Q1 2024, Q2 2024, Q3 2024, Q4 2024, Q1 2025). • Y-axis (left): US Dollars (in Millions), range approximately -500 to 4000. • Y-axis (right): US Dollars (in Millions), same range. Data Points : • Series ER (blue bars): Values for each quarter, generally ranging from just above 0 to about 2500, with a notable dip near Q1 2023. • Series OC (purple bars): Values for each quarter, generally the highest among the three, peaking near 3500–4000 in Q1 2022, Q2 2022, Q3 2022, Q4 2024, and Q1 2025. • Series FC (teal bars): Values for each quarter, intermediate between ER and OC, with a similar trend but lower than OC. Design Encodings : • ER: Blue bars. • OC: Purple bars. • FC: Teal bars. • Bars grouped by quarter. • Light blue alternating background bands for visual separation of years. • Legend in upper left with color-coded labels: ER (blue), OC (purple), FC (teal). Distribution & Trends : • All three series start high in 2022, decline through 2023, and begin to recover in 2024. • OC consistently exceeds FC, which in turn exceeds ER, except for a brief period in early 2023 where ER drops sharply. • The lowest point for ER is around Q1 2023, with a gradual recovery thereafter. • OC and FC follow similar patterns, with their lowest points also in 2023. Analysis : • The data shows a pronounced dip in all cash flow components during 2023, with recovery starting in 2024. • OC remains the dominant cash flow component throughout the period. • The sharp drop in ER in Q1 2023 is a notable anomaly. • The overall trend is cyclical, with high values at the start and end of the period and a trough in the middle. - • McLean Equity Research has found that earnings backed by significant cash flows tend to be more consistent and sustainable than non-cash earnings. - • To measure earnings quality, McLean Equity Research pays close attention to cash received as a result of the companies core business. - • Generally, cash flow from operations greater relative to operational income indicates good quality of earnings. - • Cash Flow From Operations of $3,459.0M exceeds net income of $2,227.0M. - • Cash Flow From Operations is 1.6 times that of operating income. - • Cash Flow From Operations increased 103.2% year over year to $3,459.0M in Q1 2025. - • Load Date 05/07/25. *Page 1/4* Summary : This bar chart presents the quarterly free cash flow (FCF) components—CAPX, ACC, and FC—from Q1 2022 to Q1 2025, measured in US dollars (millions). bar chart: # Title & Axes : • Title: "Free Cash Flow" • X-axis: Quarters from Q1 2022 to Q1 2025 (labels: Q1 2022, Q2 2022, Q3 2022, Q4 2022, Q1 2023, Q2 2023, Q3 2023, Q4 2023, Q1 2024, Q2 2024, Q3 2024, Q4 2024, Q1 2025) • Y-axis (right): "US Dollars (in Millions)" with tick marks from 0 to 3500 # Data Points : • Series CAPX (dark blue): Present in every quarter, values increase gradually over time. • Series ACC (purple): Present in every quarter, values fluctuate, peaking in Q4 2022 and Q1 2023, then declining and partially recovering by Q4 2024 and Q1 2025. • Series FC (teal): Highest values among the three, peaking in Q1–Q3 2022, declining through 2023, then rising again from Q1 2024 onward. # Design Encodings : • CAPX: Dark blue bars, labeled "CAPX" in legend. • ACC: Purple bars, labeled "ACC" in legend. • FC: Teal bars, labeled "FC" in legend. • Each bar is annotated with its series abbreviation (CAPX, ACC, FC). • Bars are grouped by quarter. • Background has alternating shaded vertical bands for visual clarity. # Distribution & Trends : • FC (teal) starts high (near 3000), drops to a low in Q4 2023–Q1 2024 (below 1000), then rises again to above 2000 by Q1 2025. • ACC (purple) rises sharply from Q2 2022, peaks in Q4 2022–Q1 2023 (around 2000), then declines, with a partial recovery in late 2024. • CAPX (dark blue) remains the lowest of the three, with a gradual upward trend from Q1 2022 to Q1 2025. # Analysis : • FC is the dominant component, showing a pronounced dip in 2023 and a recovery in 2024–2025. • ACC exhibits a peak in late 2022 to early 2023, then declines and partially recovers. • CAPX is consistently the smallest component but trends upward. • The data suggests cyclical or seasonal patterns in free cash flow components, with a notable trough in 2023 and recovery thereafter. - • In this chart, capital expenditures and accruals are compared to free cash flow. - • McLean Equity Research has shown that companies with high levels of free cash tend to outperform in the future. - • Accruals increased 210.2% year over year to $1,232.0M in Q1 2025. - • Capital expenditures have decreased by -33.2% over the last year while free cash flow has increased by 134.9%. - • Free cash increased 134.9% year over year to $2,753.0M in Q1 2025. - • This company is generating significant amounts of free cash flow and is clearly self-funding. Summary : This figure presents 5 years of historical financial data for AMD, showing multiple financial metrics as bar charts and a line for sales growth percentage, across five time points (Q1 2021 to Q1 2025). bar and line chart: # Title & Axes : • Title: "5 Years of Historical Data for AMD" • X-axis: Time (quarters) — Q1 2021, Q1 2022, Q1 2023, Q1 2024, Q1 2025. • Left Y-axis: Unlabeled, but values range from -10 to 80 (likely percent or index). • Right Y-axis: "US Dollars (in Millions)", range from -1000 to 4000. • Legend: ER, ACC, CFO, FC, CAPX (all bars); SL Growth % (line). # Data Points : • ER (teal bar): Q1 2021 (~50), Q1 2022 (~60), Q1 2023 (~10), Q1 2024 (~20), Q1 2025 (~40). • ACC (light blue bar): Q1 2021 (~-5), Q1 2022 (~10), Q1 2023 (~40), Q1 2024 (~10), Q1 2025 (~20). • CFO (magenta bar): Q1 2021 (~35), Q1 2022 (~65), Q1 2023 (~55), Q1 2024 (~30), Q1 2025 (~65). • FC (light green bar): Q1 2021 (~30), Q1 2022 (~60), Q1 2023 (~45), Q1 2024 (~20), Q1 2025 (~50). • CAPX (yellow bar): Q1 2021 (~8), Q1 2022 (~10), Q1 2023 (~8), Q1 2024 (~8), Q1 2025 (~10). • SL Growth % (blue line): Q1 2021 (~55%), Q1 2022 (~65%), Q1 2023 (~30%), Q1 2024 (~10%), Q1 2025 (~20%). # Design Encodings : • Bar colours: ER (teal), ACC (light blue), CFO (magenta), FC (light green), CAPX (yellow). • Line: SL Growth % (blue line, solid, with data points marked). • Dual y-axes: left for bar values, right for US Dollars (in Millions) for the bars. • Bars are grouped by quarter, with each metric shown side by side. # Distribution & Trends : • Most metrics peak in Q1 2022, especially CFO and FC. • ACC is negative in Q1 2021, positive in all other years. • SL Growth % peaks in Q1 2022, then declines sharply to Q1 2024, with a slight recovery in Q1 2025. • CAPX remains relatively stable and low across all years. # Analysis : • AMD's financial metrics (ER, CFO, FC) show a strong peak in Q1 2022, followed by a decline and partial recovery by Q1 2025. • Sales growth percentage (SL Growth %) follows a similar pattern, peaking in Q1 2022, dropping to a low in Q1 2024, and then rising slightly. • CAPX remains stable and low, while ACC fluctuates, being negative only in Q1 2021. • The data suggests a period of strong growth in 2022, a downturn, and then a modest rebound by 2025. Summary : This bar chart presents 5 years of Free Cash (FC) and Dividend (Div) data for AMD, illustrating the company's ability to pay dividends from free cash rather than net earnings, and highlighting the current and historical FC payout ratios and dividend yield. bar chart: # Title & Axes : • Title: "5 Years of FC & Dividend Data for AMD" • X-axis: Years/Quarters (Q1 2021, Q1 2022, Q1 2023, Q1 2024, Q1 2025) • Y-axis: US Dollars (in Millions), range from 0 to 3500 # Data Points : • Series: FC (Free Cash) – Q1 2021: ~1200 million USD – Q1 2022: ~3200 million USD – Q1 2023: ~2200 million USD – Q1 2024: ~900 million USD – Q1 2025: ~2700 million USD • Series: Div (Dividend) – No visible bars for Div in any year (implies zero or negligible values) # Design Encodings : • FC bars: Cyan/teal color, labeled "FC" • Div bars: Yellow color, labeled "Div" (not visible in the chart) • Legend at top left for FC and Div • Dual y-axis: Only right axis labeled (US Dollars in Millions) • No error bars or statistical overlays # Distribution & Trends : • FC values fluctuate over the 5-year period, peaking in Q1 2022 (~3200M), dipping in Q1 2024 (~900M), and recovering in Q1 2025 (~2700M). • No dividend payouts are shown for any year. # Annotations & Notes : • Current Dividend Yield is 0.00%. • Dividends are paid out of free cash, not net earnings. • FC Payout Ratio is 0.00 now and was 0.00 a year ago. • Higher FC Payout Ratio suggests greater likelihood of dividend increase. # Analysis : • AMD has generated significant free cash in most years, with a notable dip in Q1 2024. • No dividends have been paid in the observed period, as indicated by the absence of Div bars and a 0.00% dividend yield. • The FC Payout Ratio remains at 0.00, indicating that none of the free cash is being used for dividends. • The data suggests AMD is retaining its free cash rather than distributing it to shareholders as dividends. Semiconductors Industry Analysis & Recommendations
TickerMarket CapDiv YieldRSWSL / TCSL / TLTL / TATL / OCZ ScoreEV/IC RatioPEEV/FC RatioCROICOE%Risk AnalysisRecom
*Page 2/4*

chunks.text:
logo: Mclean Equity Research

Summary : This image displays the logo for "Mclean Equity Research" with the company name and the word "Research" enclosed within a white oval on a blue background.

Logo Elements :
  • Text: "Mclean Equity" (large font), "Research" (smaller font, centered below).
  • Shape: White oval outline encircling the text.
  • Background: Solid blue rectangle.
  • Font: Sans-serif, white text.
  • Layout: "Mclean Equity" is on the top line, "Research" is centered below within the oval.

Dimensions & Placement :
  • The oval is horizontally elongated, centered within the blue rectangle.
  • The text is centered both vertically and horizontally within the oval.

Analysis : 
  • The logo uses a simple, professional design with a blue and white color scheme, likely to convey trust and reliability in financial research.

Summary : This bar chart compares Return on Equity (ROE) and Economic Profit (EP) as percentages over quarterly periods from Q1 2022 to Q1 2025, illustrating trends in shareholder value.

bar chart:

# Title & Axes :
  • Title: "Shareholder Value"
  • X-axis: Quarterly periods from Q1 2022 to Q1 2025 (labels: Q1 2022, Q2 2022, Q3 2022, Q4 2022, Q1 2023, Q2 2023, Q3 2023, Q4 2023, Q1 2024, Q2 2024, Q3 2024, Q4 2024, Q1 2025)
  • Y-axis (right): "Percent %" with tick marks at -30, -25, -20, -15, -10, -5, 0, 5, 10

# Data Points :
  • ROE (Return on Equity): Blue bars, positive values, generally between 0% and 5% for all quarters.
  • EP (Economic Profit): Red bars, negative values, generally between -20% and -25% for all quarters.

# Design Encodings :
  • ROE: Solid blue bars, labeled "ROE" at the top of each bar.
  • EP: Solid red bars, labeled "EP" at the bottom of each bar.
  • Legend: Blue square for ROE, light teal square for EP.
  • Background: Alternating light blue and white vertical bands for each quarter.

# Distribution & Trends :
  • ROE remains positive but low (0% to 5%) across all quarters.
  • EP remains negative and relatively stable (around -20% to -25%) across all quarters.
  • No quarters show positive EP.

# Analysis :
  • The company consistently generates positive but modest ROE, while EP is persistently negative, indicating that although equity returns are positive, they do not exceed the cost of capital. There is no significant upward or downward trend in either metric over the observed period.

- ● This chart shows if a company is earning both an accounting profit (ROE) and an Owner Earnings (OE).
- ● OE is our proprietary metric used to determine if a company is currently adding to shareholder value.
- ● At McLean Equity Research, we believe the distinction between making an investment versus speculation is whether or not a company is creating shareholder value.
- ● The chart shows a negative trend to creating shareholder value.

Summary : This bar chart presents the cash flow components—ER, OC, and FC—over quarterly periods from Q1 2022 to Q1 2025, with values in US dollars (millions).

bar chart:
Title & Axes :
  • Title: "Cash Flow".
  • X-axis: Quarterly periods from Q1 2022 to Q1 2025 (labels: Q1 2022, Q2 2022, Q3 2022, Q4 2022, Q1 2023, Q2 2023, Q3 2023, Q4 2023, Q1 2024, Q2 2024, Q3 2024, Q4 2024, Q1 2025).
  • Y-axis (left): US Dollars (in Millions), range approximately -500 to 4000.
  • Y-axis (right): US Dollars (in Millions), same range.

Data Points :
  • Series ER (blue bars): Values for each quarter, generally ranging from just above 0 to about 2500, with a notable dip near Q1 2023.
  • Series OC (purple bars): Values for each quarter, generally the highest among the three, peaking near 3500–4000 in Q1 2022, Q2 2022, Q3 2022, Q4 2024, and Q1 2025.
  • Series FC (teal bars): Values for each quarter, intermediate between ER and OC, with a similar trend but lower than OC.

Design Encodings :
  • ER: Blue bars.
  • OC: Purple bars.
  • FC: Teal bars.
  • Bars grouped by quarter.
  • Light blue alternating background bands for visual separation of years.
  • Legend in upper left with color-coded labels: ER (blue), OC (purple), FC (teal).

Distribution & Trends :
  • All three series start high in 2022, decline through 2023, and begin to recover in 2024.
  • OC consistently exceeds FC, which in turn exceeds ER, except for a brief period in early 2023 where ER drops sharply.
  • The lowest point for ER is around Q1 2023, with a gradual recovery thereafter.
  • OC and FC follow similar patterns, with their lowest points also in 2023.

Analysis :
  • The data shows a pronounced dip in all cash flow components during 2023, with recovery starting in 2024.
  • OC remains the dominant cash flow component throughout the period.
  • The sharp drop in ER in Q1 2023 is a notable anomaly.
  • The overall trend is cyclical, with high values at the start and end of the period and a trough in the middle.

- • McLean Equity Research has found that earnings backed by significant cash flows tend to be more consistent and sustainable than non-cash earnings.
- • To measure earnings quality, McLean Equity Research pays close attention to cash received as a result of the companies core business.
- • Generally, cash flow from operations greater relative to operational income indicates good quality of earnings.
- • Cash Flow From Operations of $3,459.0M exceeds net income of $2,227.0M.
- • Cash Flow From Operations is 1.6 times that of operating income.
- • Cash Flow From Operations increased 103.2% year over year to $3,459.0M in Q1 2025.
- • Load Date 05/07/25.

Summary : This bar chart presents the quarterly free cash flow (FCF) components—CAPX, ACC, and FC—from Q1 2022 to Q1 2025, measured in US dollars (millions).

bar chart:
# Title & Axes :
  • Title: "Free Cash Flow"
  • X-axis: Quarters from Q1 2022 to Q1 2025 (labels: Q1 2022, Q2 2022, Q3 2022, Q4 2022, Q1 2023, Q2 2023, Q3 2023, Q4 2023, Q1 2024, Q2 2024, Q3 2024, Q4 2024, Q1 2025)
  • Y-axis (right): "US Dollars (in Millions)" with tick marks from 0 to 3500

# Data Points :
  • Series CAPX (dark blue): Present in every quarter, values increase gradually over time.
  • Series ACC (purple): Present in every quarter, values fluctuate, peaking in Q4 2022 and Q1 2023, then declining and partially recovering by Q4 2024 and Q1 2025.
  • Series FC (teal): Highest values among the three, peaking in Q1–Q3 2022, declining through 2023, then rising again from Q1 2024 onward.

# Design Encodings :
  • CAPX: Dark blue bars, labeled "CAPX" in legend.
  • ACC: Purple bars, labeled "ACC" in legend.
  • FC: Teal bars, labeled "FC" in legend.
  • Each bar is annotated with its series abbreviation (CAPX, ACC, FC).
  • Bars are grouped by quarter.
  • Background has alternating shaded vertical bands for visual clarity.

# Distribution & Trends :
  • FC (teal) starts high (near 3000), drops to a low in Q4 2023–Q1 2024 (below 1000), then rises again to above 2000 by Q1 2025.
  • ACC (purple) rises sharply from Q2 2022, peaks in Q4 2022–Q1 2023 (around 2000), then declines, with a partial recovery in late 2024.
  • CAPX (dark blue) remains the lowest of the three, with a gradual upward trend from Q1 2022 to Q1 2025.

# Analysis :
  • FC is the dominant component, showing a pronounced dip in 2023 and a recovery in 2024–2025.
  • ACC exhibits a peak in late 2022 to early 2023, then declines and partially recovers.
  • CAPX is consistently the smallest component but trends upward.
  • The data suggests cyclical or seasonal patterns in free cash flow components, with a notable trough in 2023 and recovery thereafter.

- • In this chart, capital expenditures and accruals are compared to free cash flow.
- • McLean Equity Research has shown that companies with high levels of free cash tend to outperform in the future.
- • Accruals increased 210.2% year over year to $1,232.0M in Q1 2025.
- • Capital expenditures have decreased by -33.2% over the last year while free cash flow has increased by 134.9%.
- • Free cash increased 134.9% year over year to $2,753.0M in Q1 2025.
- • This company is generating significant amounts of free cash flow and is clearly self-funding.

Summary : This figure presents 5 years of historical financial data for AMD, showing multiple financial metrics as bar charts and a line for sales growth percentage, across five time points (Q1 2021 to Q1 2025).

bar and line chart:

# Title & Axes :
  • Title: "5 Years of Historical Data for AMD"
  • X-axis: Time (quarters) — Q1 2021, Q1 2022, Q1 2023, Q1 2024, Q1 2025.
  • Left Y-axis: Unlabeled, but values range from -10 to 80 (likely percent or index).
  • Right Y-axis: "US Dollars (in Millions)", range from -1000 to 4000.
  • Legend: ER, ACC, CFO, FC, CAPX (all bars); SL Growth % (line).

# Data Points :
  • ER (teal bar): Q1 2021 (~50), Q1 2022 (~60), Q1 2023 (~10), Q1 2024 (~20), Q1 2025 (~40).
  • ACC (light blue bar): Q1 2021 (~-5), Q1 2022 (~10), Q1 2023 (~40), Q1 2024 (~10), Q1 2025 (~20).
  • CFO (magenta bar): Q1 2021 (~35), Q1 2022 (~65), Q1 2023 (~55), Q1 2024 (~30), Q1 2025 (~65).
  • FC (light green bar): Q1 2021 (~30), Q1 2022 (~60), Q1 2023 (~45), Q1 2024 (~20), Q1 2025 (~50).
  • CAPX (yellow bar): Q1 2021 (~8), Q1 2022 (~10), Q1 2023 (~8), Q1 2024 (~8), Q1 2025 (~10).
  • SL Growth % (blue line): Q1 2021 (~55%), Q1 2022 (~65%), Q1 2023 (~30%), Q1 2024 (~10%), Q1 2025 (~20%).

# Design Encodings :
  • Bar colours: ER (teal), ACC (light blue), CFO (magenta), FC (light green), CAPX (yellow).
  • Line: SL Growth % (blue line, solid, with data points marked).
  • Dual y-axes: left for bar values, right for US Dollars (in Millions) for the bars.
  • Bars are grouped by quarter, with each metric shown side by side.

# Distribution & Trends :
  • Most metrics peak in Q1 2022, especially CFO and FC.
  • ACC is negative in Q1 2021, positive in all other years.
  • SL Growth % peaks in Q1 2022, then declines sharply to Q1 2024, with a slight recovery in Q1 2025.
  • CAPX remains relatively stable and low across all years.

# Analysis :
  • AMD's financial metrics (ER, CFO, FC) show a strong peak in Q1 2022, followed by a decline and partial recovery by Q1 2025.
  • Sales growth percentage (SL Growth %) follows a similar pattern, peaking in Q1 2022, dropping to a low in Q1 2024, and then rising slightly.
  • CAPX remains stable and low, while ACC fluctuates, being negative only in Q1 2021.
  • The data suggests a period of strong growth in 2022, a downturn, and then a modest rebound by 2025.

Summary : This bar chart presents 5 years of Free Cash (FC) and Dividend (Div) data for AMD, illustrating the company's ability to pay dividends from free cash rather than net earnings, and highlighting the current and historical FC payout ratios and dividend yield.

bar chart:
# Title & Axes :
  • Title: "5 Years of FC & Dividend Data for AMD"
  • X-axis: Years/Quarters (Q1 2021, Q1 2022, Q1 2023, Q1 2024, Q1 2025)
  • Y-axis: US Dollars (in Millions), range from 0 to 3500

# Data Points :
  • Series: FC (Free Cash)
    – Q1 2021: ~1200 million USD
    – Q1 2022: ~3200 million USD
    – Q1 2023: ~2200 million USD
    – Q1 2024: ~900 million USD
    – Q1 2025: ~2700 million USD
  • Series: Div (Dividend)
    – No visible bars for Div in any year (implies zero or negligible values)

# Design Encodings :
  • FC bars: Cyan/teal color, labeled "FC"
  • Div bars: Yellow color, labeled "Div" (not visible in the chart)
  • Legend at top left for FC and Div
  • Dual y-axis: Only right axis labeled (US Dollars in Millions)
  • No error bars or statistical overlays

# Distribution & Trends :
  • FC values fluctuate over the 5-year period, peaking in Q1 2022 (~3200M), dipping in Q1 2024 (~900M), and recovering in Q1 2025 (~2700M).
  • No dividend payouts are shown for any year.

# Annotations & Notes :
  • Current Dividend Yield is 0.00%.
  • Dividends are paid out of free cash, not net earnings.
  • FC Payout Ratio is 0.00 now and was 0.00 a year ago.
  • Higher FC Payout Ratio suggests greater likelihood of dividend increase.

# Analysis :
  • AMD has generated significant free cash in most years, with a notable dip in Q1 2024.
  • No dividends have been paid in the observed period, as indicated by the absence of Div bars and a 0.00% dividend yield.
  • The FC Payout Ratio remains at 0.00, indicating that none of the free cash is being used for dividends.
  • The data suggests AMD is retaining its free cash rather than distributing it to shareholders as dividends.
